授業目的: The objective of this course is to investigate the social rules, both discernible and hidden, which govern everyday activities in Japan. In the course students will learn about the value systems which underlie Japanese behavior and perception and by doing so will uncover what would be considered pragmatically appropriate within particular contexts.
到達目標: Students will gain knowledge of Japanese social structures and social behavior. They will be able to ask critical questions about Japanese behavior. They will be able to explain pragmatic differences between their own culture and that of Japan. They will be able to analyze behavior and opinions in order to uncover the hidden values associated with them. They will be able to conduct thoughtful discussion of the class readings. They will be able to make clear presentations and/or reports on assigned topics.
授業方法: Online format:On-demand Btype(w/o timetable). This course comprises of a combination of teacher lectures, class discussions, and student presentations.
